intro: Cakile lanceolata var. geniculata, commonly known as the bentleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many species of mustard plants. The plant is characterized by its prostrate growth habit, with hairy stems and small, fleshy, green leaves that are often lobed or toothed. Its flowers are typically small, yellow, and borne in clusters, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. This species is adapted to sandy soils and can thrive in harsh, dry environments.
